newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan to release state shares to 14 mln citizens.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan to release state shares to 14 mln citizens.

text.p: Taiwan's top economic planning body said on Monday it would release shares of big state firms to all 14 million adult citizens through preferential treatment to prevent concentrated buying by conglomerates.

"We have completed a proposal planning various types of preferential treatment to encourage all citizens to buy shares of large state-run firms," an official at the cabinet's Council for Economic Planning and Development told Reuters.
Fourteen million -- aged over 20 -- out of the island's 21 million population would be qualified to buy 300 to 3,000 shares each as state firms are privatised, the official said.
Long-term investors would be offered preferential treatment, the official said without elaborating.
The plan was modelled on Singapore Telecommunications Ltd's successful privatisation, he said.
The official said the proposal had yet to be made final.
"This is still an initial proposal, which needs further approval by the cabinet's privatisation committee," he said.
